comment: Quick question about the master course. Are the study guide and practice questions downloadable or do I need to be online for that? Thanks!
Great channel, I've been watching all your videos in ×2 speed coz don't have time.
Chad hi, how are u? In which college do you teach?

For the second row Ag is plus one charge but Hg and Pb are plus 2 Is it supposed to be a balanced charge when it mixes with Cl, Br, and I Or should It be positive charge in which case why is Ag negative 1 only?
thank you so much for this video series!
Ag+ will form AgCl (+1 + -1 = 0) Hg2+ will form HgCl2 (2+ + 2(-1) = 0) if that answers your question?
@ChadsPrep  thank you for your response but is there a reason that we have Hg2 and not a singular one like Ag
​​ @Bulayla1426  Hg is have 2 different charge, Hg+ and Hg2+. Hg+ will make Hg2Cl2, and Hg2+ will make HgCl2.  Ag only 1 charge, Ag+ that make AgCl
